result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard T Griffin

defendant.name: Griffin, Richard T
defendant.address: 1808 West Meyer Lane, #5111, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard T Griffin appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Richard T Griffin.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kuehn is now the attorney of record.  Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for preliminary hearing in Br. 10 by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard T Griffin in court.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a preliminary hearing.  No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Richard T Griffin in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with CBJ (DOB: 02/08/1993) and her children
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard T Griffin in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Richard T Griffin in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard T Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2 and 3. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
